title: Find g(y)
text: Notice that we are revolving the curve around the y-axis, and the interval is in terms of $$y$$, so we want to rewrite the function as a function of $$y$$. We get $$x=g(y)=\frac{1}{3} y^3$$

title: Find the surface area
text: The surface area can be found with $$\int_{a}^{b} 2\pi g{\left(y\right)} \sqrt{1+{\operatorname{g'}\left(y\right)}^2} \,dy$$, where g'(y) indicates the derivative of g(y). We need to plug g(y) and intervals into this equation

title: Find the surface area
text: After plugging g(y) and the interval into the equation, we will have Surface $$Area=\int_{0}^{2} 2\pi \frac{1}{3} y^3 \sqrt{1+y^4} \,dy$$
speech: After plugging g(y) and the interval into the equation, we will have Surface  Area is equal to the integral from 0 to 2 of 2 pi 1 third y cubed, the square root of 1 plus y to the fourth end root d y

title: Simpify
text: After simplified the equation, we will have Surface $$Area=((2*pi)/3)*(\int_{0}^{2} y^3 \sqrt{1+y^4} \,dy)$$
